THEMISTOGLES. V.

(1) Themistocles, who with nine others had commanded the Athenians at Marathon, was afterwards the leading-man in the state. (12) Since he feared that the Persians would come back with a large fleet, he persuaded his countrymen to build a hundred ships with the money which came in from the mines. (3) When Xerxes came against Athens the Atheni- ans, by the advice of Themistocles, left their city and went on board their ships.
